column1: Sayanogorsk (Russian: Саяного́рск; Khakas: Саяногорск) is a town in the Republic of Khakassia
column3: located on the left bank of the Yenisei River
column5: the capital of the republic. Population: 49

column1: The town has road and water links with Abakan and Minusinsk. The town itself is located in the steppe zone.

column3: in connection with the construction of the Sayan-Shushenskaya Hydroelectric Power Plant on the Yenisei River and the Sayan Aluminum Plant in the town; the latter opened ten years later.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column3: together with two work settlements (Cheremushki and Mayna) and one rural locality (the village of Bogoslovka)
column4: incorporated as the Town of Sayanogorsk—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: the Town of Sayanogorsk is incorporated as Sayanogorsk Urban Okrug.

column2: Sayanogorsk has one of the largest aluminum smelter plants in the world. The aluminum plant provides work for the majority of the town's residents. Sayano-Shushenskaya Dam
column3: the largest hydro-electric dam in Russia and the world's 5th-largest by installed capacity
column4: lies to the south of the town.
